events.description: The release of new car sales data for the UK in January 2026.

facts.fact_text: UK new car sales rose by 3.4% year-on-year to 144,127 units in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: New car sales in the UK rose by 3.4% from the previous year to 144,127 units in January of 2026

facts.fact_text: Plug-in hybrid electric vehicle registrations increased by 47.3% to 18,557 units.

evidences.evidence_text: Registrations for plug-in hybrid electric vehicles soared (47.3% to 18,557)

facts.fact_text: Battery electric vehicle registrations reached 29,654 units, representing over 20% of the market share.

evidences.evidence_text: registrations of battery electric vehicles were steady (0.1% to 29,654), over 20% of the market share

facts.fact_text: Petrol engine vehicle sales declined by 1.9% to 68,757 units.

evidences.evidence_text: sales fell for petrol engine vehicles (-1.9% to 68,757)

claims.claim_text: The growth in UK car registrations slowed in January compared to the previous month.

evidences.evidence_text: slowing from the 3.9% increase in the previous month

claims.claim_text: Battery electric vehicle registrations remained steady during the period.

evidences.evidence_text: registrations of battery electric vehicles were steady (0.1% to 29,654)

evidence.evidence_text: New car sales in the UK rose by 3.4% from the previous year
Registrations for plug-in hybrid electric vehicles soared (47.3% to 18,557) to mark over 12% of total registrations
